revised_title: The Influence of Natural Agents on the Virulence of the Tubercle-Bacillus
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to determine the effects of air and light exposure on the virulence of the tubercle-bacillus, which causes tuberculosis. They found that exposure to daylight and fresh air rapidly reduced the virulence of the bacteria, while exposure to darkness and confined air maintained the bacteria's ability to cause infection. These findings have important implications for understanding the transmission of tuberculosis in different environments.
